stimulusHtml: The scene depicted in the painting best supports which of the following arguments about social interactions between Europeans and Africans during the sixteenth century?

features.html:
The Berardo Collection, Lisbon, Portugal

This painting illustrates the substantial presence of Africans in urban Iberian port cities like Lisbon.

choicesHtml: The social exchanges between African and European kingdoms influenced the spread of the Islamic faith across Northern Europe.
Explorers influenced the European view that Africa was a source for enslaved labor rather than a source of knowledge and learning.
African people in Europe were employed in a wide variety of jobs and interacted directly with European peoples of other racial and ethnic groups.
The blending of European Christian and indigenous African belief systems was a strategy Europeans employed to justify their presence in African kingdoms.
